decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of the decision notice. Reason: To comply with the provisions of S.51 of the Planning & Compulsory Purchase Act 2004.

Prior to the commencement of the development (except demolition to ground floor slab level), a remediation strategy to deal with the risks associated with contamination of the site in respect of the development hereby permitted, shall be submitted to, and approved in writing by, the Local Planning Authority. This strategy will include the following components:A.	A preliminary risk assessment which has identified:o	all previous uses.o	potential contaminants associated with those uses.o	a conceptual model of the site indicating sources, pathways and receptors.o	potentially unacceptable risks arising from contamination at the site.B.	A site investigation scheme, based on (A) to provide information for a detailed assessment of the risk to all receptors that may be affected, including those offsite. C.	The results of the site investigation and the detailed risk assessment referred to in (B) and, based on these, an options appraisal and remediation strategy giving full details of the remediation measures required and how they are to be undertaken.Reason: To avoid risk to public health and the environment.

Following the practical completion of the development, an updated Energy Statement shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, reflecting the measures taken in practice in Be Lean, Be Clean and Be Green stages of the Energy hierarchy to reduce carbon emitted from the operation of a development and its services, as committed to in the design stage, and the amended New Development Carbon Compensation to be paid for the remaining emissions.Reason: In the interest of sustainable development and to ensure that the Local Planning Authority may be satisfied that CO2 emission reduction targets by renewable energy are met in accordance with Policies DMD51-54 of the Development Management Document (2014), Policy SI 2 of the New London Plan 2021 and Policy SE2 of the emerging Enfield Local Plan 2019-2041 due for examination.

The development hereby approved shall achieve a BREEAM rating of 'Excellent' or higher or an equivalent independent measure of energy performance and sustainability. Where the performance of the development is measured using BREEAM V6 (Industrial Shell and Core), it shall achieve not less than the total credits for each of the Energy, Materials and Waste categories in the BREEAM Pre-Assessment hereby approved.A post completion certificate (or equivalent certification) confirming that the development has been completed in accordance with the required BREEAM rating and has maintained or exceeded the approved total credit scores for each of the Energy, Materials and Waste categories, shall be submitted to the LPA for approval within six months of first occupation of the relevant unit or building.Reason: To ensure the development minimises operational carbon dioxide emissions and achieves the highest levels of sustainable design and construction in accordance with DMD51 of the Development Management Document (2014) and Policy SE2 of the emerging Enfield Local Plan 2019-2041 due for examination.

Prior to the occupation of a unit, an acoustic report, written in line with the methodology in BS4142:2014+A1 2019, shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority for the respective unit. The report must set out the sound level generated from the mechanical plant for the respective unit and state the noise control measures to be employed to ensure the noise from the combined plant at the site does not exceed a level of 5dB below the typical measured background noise level measured as L(A)90 minutes during operational hours, at the façade of the nearest or most noise affected residential property.Reason: To protect the local amenity from noise and disturbance.

Prior to the occupation of the development, a verification report demonstrating the completion of works set out in the approved remediation strategy and the effectiveness of the remediation shall be submitted to, and approved in writing, by the Local Planning Authority. The report shall include results of sampling and monitoring carried out in accordance with the approved verification plan to demonstrate that the site remediation criteria have been met.Reason: To avoid risk to public health and the environment.

Prior to occupation, the development shall achieve a Certificate of Compliance to the relevant Secure by Design Guide(s) or alternatively achieve Crime Prevention Standards submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority in conjunction with the Metropolitan Police. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and thereafter shall be fully retained and maintained as such for the lifetime of the development.	Reason: In the interest of creating safer, secure, sustainable communities.

The sound insulation reduction performance for the buildings to the west of the site at the boundary with Henkel House must have a minimum of Rw 28dB.	Reason: To protect the residential amenity from noise and disturbance.

Prior to occupation details of the electrical charging points shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Electric vehicle charging points shall be provided in accordance with the approved details  and shall be permanently maintained and retained. Reason: To ensure that the development complies with the sustainable development policy requirements of the London Plan.

Prior to occupation the cycle parking spaces shall be provided on site as shown on the approved Cycle Shelter Details (Drawing: UMC-0100-SI-DR-A 0609 P02) and the facilities retained for the life of the permission. Reason: To ensure the provision of cycle parking in accordance with Policy T6.1 of the London Plan (2021), the Council's adopted standards and London Cycling Design Standards Chapter 8.

The development shall not be occupied until such time as the existing vehicle crossing points to Southbury Road have been removed and the footway reinstated.REASON: In the interests of ensuring the redundant feature to the street scene as a direct result of the development is removed and the highway reinstated.

Prior to their use, a schedule and samples of external materials to be supplied to the local planning authority for approval alongside photographic examples of their previous use shall be submitted and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The development shall be implemented in accordance with the approved details and permanently maintained as such.Reason: In order to ensure that the building has an acceptable external appearance.

Notwithstanding the details set out in the submitted Preliminary Drainage Strategy (Drawings EN1-HDR-XX-XX-DR-C-108001 REVISION P01), June 2024, prior to the commencement of any construction work (except demolition, site preparation and enabling works) , details of the Sustainable Drainage Strategy shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and must conform with the Landscaping Strategy. The details shall include:Sizes, storage volumes, cross-sections, long-sections (where appropriate) and specifications of all the source control SuDS measures including rain gardens, green roofs, swale and permeable paving.Final sizes, storage volumes, invert levels, cross-sections and specifications of all site control SuDS measures including ponds, soakaways and underground tanks. Include calculations demonstrating functionality where relevant.REASON : To ensure the sustainable management of water, minimise flood risk, minimise discharge of surface water outside of the curtilage of the property and ensure that the drainage system will remain   functional throughout the lifetime of the development in accordance with Policy CP28 of the Core Strategy, DMD 61, and Policies SI12 & SI13 of the London Plan and the NPPF.

Prior to completion of superstructure works, the following information to be submitted and agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority:o	Specification of soil, ground works and planting (including irrigation, tree support and grass cutting protection measures).o	Specification for green / brown roofs and living walls.o	Responsibility and arrangements for landscape maintenance and management which is consistent with management of rain gardens / bioretention areas.Reason: To ensure the provision of amenity, and biodiversity enhancements, afforded by appropriate landscape design in accordance with adopted policy, and to ensure highway safety.

The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved external lighting details as set out in the External Lighting Report by HDR ref. EN1-HDR-XX-XX-RP-E-632001) before it is occupied. The external lighting shall be retained and maintained as such for the lifetime of the development. Reason: To ensure that the development does not prejudice the amenities of adjoining occupiers and / or the visual amenities of the surrounding area, and to ensure that the development protects community safety.

Prior to the commencement of the development, a (demolition and) construction management plan shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. The (demolition and) construction management plan shall be based on the principles set out in the Outline Construction Management Plan (June 2024) prepared by KAM Project Consultants Ltd.The (demolition and) construction management plan shall be written in accordance with Transport For London Construction Logistic Planning Guidance and containa)	Details of construction access and associated traffic management.b)	Arrangements for the loading, unloading and turning of delivery, construction and service vehicles.c)	Arrangements for the parking of contractors' vehicles.d)	Arrangements for wheel cleaning.e)	Arrangements for the storage of materials.f)	Hours of work.g)	The storage and removal of excavation material.h)	Measures to reduce danger to cyclists.i)	Dust mitigationsj)	Membership of the Considerate Contractors SchemeThe development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved (demolition and) construction management plan unless otherwise agreed by the Local Planning Authority.Reason: To ensure construction does not lead to damage of the nearby public road network, minimise disruption to the neighbouring properties and protect the local amenity from construction dust.
description: Demolition of all existing buildings/structures and erection of new flexible industrial/logistics units falling within Use Classes E(g)(ii)/(iii), B2 and/or B8 and all associated infrastructure works, access arrangements, parking, and hard and soft landscaping.
